page.title: 09HEDGE SURVEY
page.content: We all did an environmental project on hedges in our grid from the 1st January-1st July 1985.Hedges are useful boundary markers and wind breaks.They provide a habitat for wild life on which we all depend. Hedges in our grid compare with alot of other areas,they are on the whole neglected and over grown because of the dying art of Laying a hedge.Only Mr Ogbourne of Wanborough can now lay a hedge properly. The hedge is alive and always changing each time we passed ours we noticed something different buds,leaves,twigs,flowers,plants,anima ls,birds and insects. Birds use hedges as their territory other birds come looking for a mate.Nests abound and in winter the hedge is a shelter and a source of food.Likewise for animals and insects.
